content:
Dear participants of the CG Connectathon Track, we will track the participants in this spreadsheet:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZgcdZ-iNEMFaztuND5EHSxyQP8M4GUbmKmEN6XzQtNU/edit#gid=1775022935
Testserver would be:
http://fhirtest.uhn.ca/home?serverId=home_r4&pretty=false
baseUrl: http://hapi.fhir.org/baseR4
As the Clinical Genomics IG currently needs more examples it would be nice to collect examples through the Connectathon. I'll post a link to a spreadsheet collecting the examples later.
Jason from Epic had an emergency and won't be here for the weekend, but Epic's server is up and running.

We just added an example report of somatic tumor mutations of a german genomic analysis service provider:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/18T4RS0VnrJdLS3k79skbrZ0cYyL1U53t

I've created a spreadsheet to capture all examples:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mXVGk9fyqJTGfzLOcmsT27cFC-yHC_hXRK_FL775gQU/edit?usp=sharing
CG track - we have setup a break-out session to discuss complex variation representations. We will meet at 5:00 PM (17:00) in the President room.

[cross-posted from Terminology Services connectathon track]

FYI, we (NMDP) are in the process of inventing a new code system for nomenclature-level HLA (and KIR) data. The main purpose of the new code system is to add a compositional grammar to established standard nomenclatures. These nomenclatures are important for transplantation scenarios, to describe donor and recipient tissue types. A (currently draft) web site describing the Genotype List String Code (GLSC) code system is here:

https://glstring.org/

Review and comments on the code system and web site content/narrative would be appreciated.

As hapi (R4) is down currently we can use Grahames Server:
http://test.fhir.org/r4
added: GF18987 and added it in the current IG

Regarding the discussion about SMART sandbox and EHR simulator, this may be of interest. Looks like the new beta sandbox includes an EHR simulator.
https://sandbox-beta.hspconsortium.org/
For anyone participating or interested in the Clinical Genomics Track, we will have conversations here
